Trigger.script: local line = matches[1] local direction = "north" local label = direction_markers.make_label("leave", direction) local line_color = direction_markers.line_colors["leave"] selectString(line, 1) replace("") cinsertText(line_color .. matches[2] .. ScriptGroup.name: Direction Markers

Script.name: README
Script.script:
direction_markers.help = [[ Direction Markers Author: Octavia Version: 1.0 Changelog: - 1.0, 2015-2-10 - Initial release.
This highlights all occurrences of directions (north, south, etc.) by surrounding them with special markers, highlighting them, and making them all caps. Most of these effects can be customized from within the script: - direction_markers.markers : Edit this to change which characters are used to surround the direction. - direction_markers.emphasis : Edit this to change how the directions appear. Default is capitalization. - direction_markers.colors : Edit this to change the color of the directions themselves. - direction_markers.line_colors : Edit this to change the color of the entire line a direction occurs in. - direction_markers.repeat_marker : Edit this to change how many times the marker character is repeated when it is used to surround a direction.
The commands are as follows: - direction markers help : Show this message. - direction markers make triggers : Regenerate the triggers for replacement. Using this should not be necessary in most cases. ]]

Script.name: make_label
Script.script:
function direction_markers.make_label(type, direction) local marker = direction_markers.make_marker(type, direction) local emphasis = direction_markers.emphasis[direction] local color = direction_markers.colors[type]
local label if marker ~= "" then label = marker .. " " .. emphasis .. " " .. marker else label = emphasis end label = color .. label .. "<grey>"
return label end

Script.name: make_marker
Script.script:
function direction_markers.make_marker(type, direction) local repeat_marker = direction_markers.repeat_marker[type] local marker_char = direction_markers.markers[direction]
local marker = marker_char for index = 1, repeat_marker - 1 do marker = marker .. marker_char end
return marker end

Script.name: make_triggers
Script.script:
function direction_markers.make_triggers() -- For each pattern for index, pattern in ipairs(direction_markers.patterns) do -- Determine the type of pattern local type = pattern[1]
-- Pick which type of directions to use local directions if pattern[2] == "going" then directions = direction_markers.going_directions elseif pattern[2] == "coming" then directions = direction_markers.coming_directions else echo("Direction Markers: Error: Could not determine type of direction.\n") end
-- For each direction for direction_index, direction in ipairs(directions) do local name = direction_markers.make_name(pattern, direction) local parent = direction_markers.name local regex = direction_markers.make_regex(pattern, direction, type) local code = direction_markers.make_code(pattern, direction, type)
--if not exists(name, "trigger") then permRegexTrigger(name, parent, { regex }, code) --else --echo("Direction Markers: Error: Could not create trigger '" .. name .. "' since it already exists.\n") --end end end end

Script.name: make_name
Script.script:
function direction_markers.make_name(pattern, direction) local result = ""
-- Skip the first two elements in pattern, which define the pattern for index = 3, #pattern do local element = pattern[index] if element == "<direction>" then result = result .. direction .. " " elseif element ~= "<match>" then result = result .. element .. " " end end
return string.trim(result) end

Script.name: make_regex
Script.script:
function direction_markers.make_regex(pattern, direction, type) result = "^"
for index = 3, #pattern do local element = pattern[index] if element == "<match>" then result = result .. "(.+) " elseif element == "<direction>" then result = result .. direction .. " " else result = result .. element .. " " end end
if type ~= "track" then result = string.trim(result) .. "\\.$" else result = string.trim(result) .. "$" end
return result end

Script.name: make_code
Script.script:
function direction_markers.make_code(pattern, direction, type) local replace_expression = "" local match = 2
for index = 3, #pattern do local element = pattern[index] if element == "<match>" then replace_expression = replace_expression .. "matches[" .. match .. "]" match = match + 1 elseif element == "<direction>" then replace_expression = replace_expression .. "label" else replace_expression = replace_expression .. '"' if index ~= 3 then replace_expression = replace_expression .. " " end replace_expression = replace_expression .. element .. ' "' end if index ~= #pattern then replace_expression = replace_expression .. " .. " else if type ~= "track" then replace_expression = replace_expression .. " .. \".\"" end end end
replace_expression = "line_color .. " .. replace_expression .. " .. \"<grey>\""
local result = "local line = matches[1]\n" result = result .. "local direction = \"" .. direction .. "\"\n" result = result .. "local label = direction_markers.make_label(\"" .. type .. "\", direction)\n" result = result .. "local line_color = direction_markers.line_colors[\"" .. type .. "\"]\n" result = result .. "selectString(line, 1)\n" result = result .. "replace(\"\")\n" result = result .. "cinsertText(" .. replace_expression .. ")" return result end
--local line = matches[1] --local direction = matches[3]
--local label = direction_markers.make_label("leave", direction)
--selectString(line, 1) --replace(matches[2] .. " leaves " .. label .. " riding " .. matches[4] .. ".")
